net.cnri.apps.doserver

Class ExternalInterface

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cnri.apps.doserver.ExternalInterface
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DOOperation

    public class ExternalInterface
extends java.lang.Object
implements DOOperation
    This class defines an object that provides access to internal server operations.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Returns a list of operations that this operator can perform on the object identified by the DOOperationContext parameter.

      Performs the given operation (which this object has advertised that it can handle) which consists of reading input (if any is expected) from the given InputStream and writing the output of the operation (if any) to the OutputStream.

    • Method Detail

      • canHandleOperation

        public boolean canHandleOperation(DOOperationContext context)
        Returns true iff this object can perform the given operation on behalf of the caller on the given object. The operation, object, caller, and request parameters are all provided by the given DOOperationContext object.
        Specified by:
        canHandleOperation in interface DOOperation

      • listOperations

        public java.lang.String[] listOperations(DOOperationContext context)
        Returns a list of operations that this operator can perform on the object identified by the DOOperationContext parameter.
        Specified by:
        listOperations in interface DOOperation

      • performOperation

        public void performOperation(DOOperationContext context,
                             java.io.InputStream in,
                             java.io.OutputStream out)
        Performs the given operation (which this object has advertised that it can handle) which consists of reading input (if any is expected) from the given InputStream and writing the output of the operation (if any) to the OutputStream. This method should always close the input and output streams when finished with them. If there are any errors in the input, the error message must be communicated on the OutputStream since all errors must be at the application level. Any exceptions thrown by this method will *not* be communicated to the caller and are therefore not acceptable.
        Specified by:
        performOperation in interface DOOperation
